30 // =================================================================================== //
31 // STATIC MEMBERS
32 // =================================================================================== //
33 
34 // These members are initialized in the header, but the C++ standard states
35 // that you can take the address of a static member if (and only if) it has
36 // an out-of-class definition.
37 const int8_t TreeConstants::MAX_LEVEL;
38 const int8_t TreeConstants::MAX_CHILDREN;
39 const uint32_t TreeConstants::MAX_LENGTH;
40 
41 // =================================================================================== //
42 // CLASS IMPLEMENTATION //
43 // =================================================================================== //
44 
48 const TreeConstants &
49 TreeConstants::instance(uint8_t dim) {
50  assert(dim == 2 || dim == 3);
51  return instances()[dim];
52 }
53 
56 const TreeConstants::Instances &
57 TreeConstants::instances() {
58  static TreeConstants::Instances instances = {{
59  TreeConstants(0),
60  TreeConstants(0),
61  TreeConstants(2),
62  TreeConstants(3)
63  }};
64 
65  return instances;
66 }
67 
71 TreeConstants::TreeConstants(uint8_t dim) {
72  initialize(dim);
73 }
74 
78 void
79 TreeConstants::initialize(uint8_t dim) {
80 
81  nChildren = uint8_t(1)<<dim;
82  nFaces = 2*dim;
83  nNodes = uint8_t(1)<<dim;
84  nEdges = (dim-2)*12;
85  nNodesPerFace = uint8_t(1)<<(dim-1);
86 
87  oppositeFace[0] = 1;
88  oppositeFace[1] = 0;
89  oppositeFace[2] = 3;
90  oppositeFace[3] = 2;
91  oppositeFace[4] = 5;
92  oppositeFace[5] = 4;
93 
94  nodeFace[0][0] = 0;
95  nodeFace[0][1] = 2;
96  nodeFace[0][2] = 4;
97  nodeFace[1][0] = 1;
98  nodeFace[1][1] = 2;
99  nodeFace[1][2] = 4;
100  nodeFace[2][0] = 0;
101  nodeFace[2][1] = 3;
102  nodeFace[2][2] = 4;
103  nodeFace[3][0] = 1;
104  nodeFace[3][1] = 3;
105  nodeFace[3][2] = 4;
106  nodeFace[4][0] = 0;
107  nodeFace[4][1] = 2;
108  nodeFace[4][2] = 5;
109  nodeFace[5][0] = 1;
110  nodeFace[5][1] = 2;
111  nodeFace[5][2] = 5;
112  nodeFace[6][0] = 0;
113  nodeFace[6][1] = 3;
114  nodeFace[6][2] = 5;
115  nodeFace[7][0] = 1;
116  nodeFace[7][1] = 3;
117  nodeFace[7][2] = 5;
118

426 
427  for (int level = 0; level < MAX_LEVEL; ++level) {
428  lengths[level] = uint32_t(1) << (MAX_LEVEL - level);
429  areas[level] = uint64_t(1) << ((dim - 1) * (MAX_LEVEL - level));
430  volumes[level] = uint64_t(1) << (dim * (MAX_LEVEL - level));
431  }
432 
433 }
